mods.abstract: RUNAWAY FROM the subscriber, on Wednesday night, 14th inst., a bright Mulatto Boy, named MALBURY, 17 years of age, 5 feet high, had on when he left a pair of blue cottonade pants, a green winter coat, a white hat, a pair of brogan-shoes, split in the instep. Said boy formerly belonged to Zachariah Booth, of Shelby county, from whom he ranaway two years ago, and was caught near Griffin, in Cherokee county, Texas. I will give fifty dollars reward for siad boy, delivered to DUNN & YATES, Shreveport; to A. FARBER, Henderson, Texas; or secured in any jail where I can get him, and all extra expense which may be incurred. MYERS BRADY. January 21, 1857.
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
